props.synopsis: ACT Supreme Court Justice Louise Taylor says Nathaniel Coulter, 22, was tasered despite the fact he was sitting in a car wearing a seat belt and in a submissive position after a dramatic car chase.

title.children: 'Used to punish': Judge criticises tasering by police in Canberra man's arrest

image.altText: Labradors are being trained to help PTSD sufferers

props.synopsis: Army veteran Chris Hodder was living with anxiety and PTSD, but says a pairing with service dog Bella has "changed my life for the better".

title.children: What happens to guide dogs who don't make it through training?

image.altText: The Alexander Maconochie Centre in the ACT.

props.synopsis: A coroner examining the suicide of a detainee at Canberra's jail has found the ACT had accommodated prisoners in cells they knew to be unsafe.

title.children: Luke was placed in a jail cell with a known suicide risk during COVID. He died the next day

image.altText: The scene of a car crash at night.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old charged with the death of a man in a collision earlier this year is set to face another charge, after a passenger injured in the crash died this week.

title.children: Teenager facing more charges after a second passenger dies from Barton Highway crash injuries

image.altText: Irma Palasics

props.synopsis: Undercover police followed a suspect on a camping trip from Melbourne to Cape York in the cold case investigation into the alleged murder of Canberra woman Irma Palasics.

title.children: Man denied bail as details emerge of undercover cop following suspect to help solve violent home invasion cold case

image.altText: A graphic of a street with streetlights changing their intensity. Stars in the sky become more visible as the lights are dimmed.

props.synopsis: An "adaptive lighting" project in Canberra, which reduced the brightness of streetlights by up to half, showed a 25 per cent reduction in light pollution.

title.children: Turning down streetlights at night shown to reduce light pollution and carbon emissions

image.altText: Two men wearing hard hats and hi-visibility walk into the opening of a large tunnel, several times their height.

props.synopsis: After delays, multi-billion-dollar cost blowouts and a disappointing performance by boring machine Florence, Snowy Hydro picks up an additional boring machine hoping to make sure the project can be completed on time.

title.children: Snowy Hydro buys another boring machine, hoping to make up for lost time

image.altText: A woman points in front of a crowd

props.synopsis: After weeks of turmoil and President Joe Biden's historic decision to step aside, Kamala Harris has made her pitch to the American people to vote for her over Donald Trump. Here's what you missed.

title.children: With just weeks to prepare, Kamala Harris gives the biggest speech of her life. These were the key moments

image.altText: A laneway littered with bricks after an earthquake.

props.synopsis: The epicentre was near Muswellbrook in the Upper Hunter and sparked school evacuations and power outages.

title.children: 'Legs are still like jelly': Blackouts, schools evacuated as earthquake rocks NSW

image.altText: A black sign with 'CFMEU Victoria' written on it, hanging on a construction site.

props.synopsis: The construction arm of the embattled CFMEU has been forced into administration effective immediately.

title.children: CFMEU construction arm placed into administration effective immediately, including WA and ACT branches

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with Micaela Cronin.

props.synopsis: An expert panel examining how to best prevent violence against women and children has called on alcohol, gambling and porn companies to be more proactive in tackling the crisis.

title.children: Family violence review calls for total gambling ad ban and tougher alcohol sale laws

image.altText: A transgender woman walks past photographs outside a court house.

props.synopsis: The exclusion of a transgender woman from a female-only app constituted unlawful discrimination due to gender identity, according to a landmark Federal Court ruling.

title.children: Transgender woman's exclusion from female-only app was unlawful, judge finds

image.altText: A man sits in the steps of a bus

props.synopsis: Danny Reinhold couldn't afford to rent a permanent home. His fight to live in a bus has led to a rule change for temporary homes that will help others at risk of rough sleeping.

title.children: WA pensioner took on law and won right to live in his bus, sparking statewide rule change

image.altText: F1 reserve driver Jack Doohan during the launch of the Alpine F1 car, wearing a racing suit with no helmet

props.synopsis: Australian racing driver Jack Doohan will compete in Formula 1 next season after being announced as Alpine's newest driver.

title.children: 'Dream come true': Doohan legacy continues as Jack confirmed as Alpine's newest F1 driver

image.altText: Adam Reynolds grimaces while teammates standing behind him, catching their breath

props.synopsis: Brisbane narrowly lost last year's grand final and must overcome injuries to key players to keep their premiership dream alive in 2024. Follow live.

title.children: Injured Broncos face must-win clash to keep faint finals dream alive

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Kick-off after an emotional Shaun Johnson is given a guard of honour
Team lists in for the Warriors and Bulldogs
Warriors name their home ground after Shaun Johnson

image.altText: A middle-aged bald man in a suit smiles as he walks down a corridor with an ABC News logo behind him.

props.synopsis: At 18, David Anderson took a job changing tea towels and sorting mail at the ABC — 35 years later, he's set to bow out as managing director.

title.children: 'He often acted as a human shield': David Anderson to exit ABC after restoring 'stability'

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.

title.children: Chalmers promises RBA board won't be turfed out, in a bid to win Coalition support for overhaul

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and suit jacket with a farm in the background.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese rebuffs calls to apologise for making a live export joke to a room full of farmers, after WA Labor Premier Roger Cook said the gag "touched a raw nerve" in his state.

title.children: 'Confected outrage': PM resists calls from WA premier and Nationals to apologise for live export joke

image.altText: Anthony Albanese grimaces while looking across the table at Peter Dutton as he speaks

props.synopsis: The battle between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris showcases the differences between America's presidential and Australia's Westminster systems, and the contrasts in money, campaigning and razzamatazz.

title.children: Unlike the US, political star power is absent in Australia, likely for the better

image.altText: Dump trucks are moving coal from an open coal mine pit

props.synopsis: Queensland's mining industry regulator has effectively shut down the Byerwen coal mine, where a 56-year-old Bundaberg man died on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Bowen Basin coal mine operations on hold after second fatality in three weeks

image.altText: A group of footballers in yellow and brown jerseys celebrate on a footy field.

props.synopsis: A pay dispute between electrical workers and TasNetworks throw's tomorrow's AFL clash between Hawthorn and North Melbourne in Launceston into chaos, with the league forced to reschedule the game.

title.children: Union pay dispute causes crucial AFL clash to be rescheduled

image.altText: An older man with a serious expression and a 'water is life' shirt looks at the camera. More people are behind him.

props.synopsis: A group of native title holders from Central Australia have launched a fresh appeal against one of the largest groundwater licenses granted in Northern Territory history.

title.children: Native title holders launch fresh appeal over Singleton Station groundwater licence

image.altText: Two people stand and smile holding award.

props.synopsis: A heroic boy from Hughenden in Queensland's north-west is presented with a bravery award for staying calm and collected during an emergency call to get help for his mum.

title.children: Twelve-year-old boy recognised for bravery and 'amazing' calm after mum hit by fireball from faulty mower

image.altText: Someone holding up a diamond roughly half the size of a human palm

props.synopsis: A 2,492 carat diamond recovered from a mine in central Botswana is the largest ever found in the country and potentially the second largest in the world.

title.children: Biggest diamond in a century found at Botswana mine

image.altText: Two boats pictured from afar burning on the ocean and creating large black smoke clouds to rise.

props.synopsis: Twenty fishermen caught at Kuri Bay earlier this month have been handed fines and suspended jail terms by a Darwin court.

title.children: Indonesian fishermen hit with fines, suspended jail terms after Kimberley operation

image.altText: Three women and three men pose for a photo around a TV studio desk.

props.synopsis: After five years, thousands of coffees, and more early-morning alarms than you could poke a stick at, Lisa Millar is farewelling News Breakfast.

title.children: Lisa Millar's reflections on switching off the News Breakfast alarm one last time

image.altText: A young woman with long brown hair wearing stares into the distance

props.synopsis: Tess Hansen is among an increasing number of people being diagnosed with POTS — a condition associated with long COVID — but experts say doctors are not being taught enough about it, leading to long periods of confusion and under-treatment.

title.children: POTS cases are rapidly on the rise, but diagnosing it takes years

image.altText: Mike Lynch smiles as he wears a suit and walks from the High Court.

props.synopsis: The Italian coastguard say the body of Mike Lynch has been recovered from the wreckage of a superyacht.

title.children: Manufacturer blames 'unreasonable errors' for Sicily superyacht sinking as body of Mike Lynch recovered from wreckage

image.altText: two construction workers smiling in hi-vis near the shore by the ocean

props.synopsis: Kalidonis NT has been found guilty of two charges laid by NT WorkSafe over the death of a 50-year-old construction worker in the remote community of Maningrida.

title.children: Darwin company guilty of NT WorkSafe charges after violent death of employee

image.altText: Modi in a white long shirt and vest shakes hands with Zelenskyy in green army clothes in front of a meeting table

props.synopsis: India's trade and defence relationship with Russia means it has stayed out of commenting on Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine — for the most part.

title.children: Modi's visit to Ukraine is complicated, not just because of his hug with Putin

image.altText: Women in white coats holding candles

props.synopsis: It's something exhausted doctors do every day – find a quiet corner of the hospital for a quick nap. But in India, it ended in a brutal murder. Will it change a nation? WARNING: The details in this story might be distressing to some readers.

title.children: An exhausted female doctor took a nap at work. What happened next has horrified India

image.altText: A security officer draws a gun as bodies lie on the ground and people run

props.synopsis: Each time the Secret Service fails, it learns and adapts to keep its "protectees" safe. Can it fulfil its duties of keeping wannabe presidents Donald Trump and Kamala Harris safe in the lead up to the US election?

title.children: As the US election draws closer, can the Secret Service keep Trump and Harris safe?

image.altText: Two corflute signs side-by-side on the ground, showing the faces of NT politicians Eva Lawler and Lia Finocchiaro.

props.synopsis: With polls closing tomorrow, the NT election race has been dominated by a single issue — crime. But the campaign to win government for the next four years has taken some surprising turns.

title.children: Crime dominates NT election campaign featuring curfew, police apology

image.altText: Bunbury tornado homes destroyed

props.synopsis: In a blink of an eye, a freak tornado wreaked havoc and destruction on the coastal community of Bunbury. Repairs are well underway, but the emotional wounds of the terrifying experience are likely to stay with locals for decades to come.

title.children: It took 10 minutes for a freak storm to inflict chaos on this town. Three weeks later it happened again
